::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="100%" .bg-blue}
**Conceptual framework**

The hub integrates Self-Determination Theory (autonomy, competence, relatedness) with political psychology to explain how societal contexts (democratic quality, threat, policy communication) shape psychological needs, which in turn predict well-being and civic attitudes.
:::
:::

<br>

## Key domains

::: {.columns style="display:flex; gap:1em;"}
::: {.column width="50%" .bg-blue}
**DOMAIN 1**

#### Basic psychological needs & well-being

Establishes how autonomy, competence, and relatedness predict well-being across contexts and cultures.
:::

::: {.column width="50%" .bg-blue}
**DOMAIN 2**

#### Governance & motivation

Links democratic quality and policy environments to need-supportive experiences and engagement.
:::
:::

<br>

::: {.columns style="display:flex; gap:1em;"}
::: {.column width="50%" .bg-blue}
**DOMAIN 3**

#### Threat & Attitudes

Explores how threat and communication styles shift motivation and democratic support.
:::

::: {.column width="50%" .bg-blue}
**DOMAIN 4**

#### Cross-cultural measurement & methods

Provides invariance testing, harmonization, and open pipelines for reproducibility.
:::
:::

<script>
function filterSelection(category, el) {
  const pubs = document.getElementsByClassName("pub");
  for (let i = 0; i < pubs.length; i++) {
    pubs[i].style.display =
      category === "all" || pubs[i].classList.contains(category) ? "block" : "none";
  }
  // active button state
  const btns = document.getElementsByClassName("filter-btn");
  for (let i = 0; i < btns.length; i++) btns[i].classList.remove("active");
  if (el) el.classList.add("active");
}

// search
document.getElementById("searchInput").addEventListener("keyup", function () {
  const filter = this.value.toLowerCase();
  const pubs = document.getElementsByClassName("pub");
  for (let i = 0; i < pubs.length; i++) {
    pubs[i].style.display = pubs[i].innerText.toLowerCase().includes(filter) ? "block" : "none";
  }
});

// show all on load
document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function () {
  filterSelection("all", document.querySelector(".filter-btn.active"));
});
</script>
